meanings.definition: The muscular tube connecting the throat to the stomach.
meanings.sent1: The esophagus helps move food from the throat to the stomach.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the food traveling down my esophagus after swallowing.
meanings.sent3: The esophagus must be a hard worker, always shuttling food down.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the esophagus, tirelessly pushing things forward.
meanings.sent5: The esophagus, like a smooth slide, guides food to its destination.

meanings.definition: A part of the digestive system that carries food from the mouth to the stomach.
meanings.sent1: When you eat, the esophagus transports the food to your stomach.
meanings.sent2: The esophagus is a vital part of the digestive process.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if the esophagus ever gets tired of its food delivery job.
meanings.sent4: The esophagus, like a conveyor belt, moves food efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The esophagus, a reliable courier, delivers meals to the stomach.
